org.jacktheclipper.frontend.utils

Class RedirectAttributesUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacktheclipper.frontend.utils.RedirectAttributesUtils

  • public class RedirectAttributesUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class for the RedirectAttributes of the Spring framework. This ensures that all parameters are named consistently and their values are consistent as well. This allows fragments like alertInfo in layout.html to be displayed correctly all the time.

    • Constructor Summary

      RedirectAttributesUtils()

      static void populateDefaultRedirectAttributes(org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes, boolean error, java.lang.String message)
      Populates the RedirectAttributes with its default values.

    • Method Detail

      • populateDefaultRedirectAttributes

        public static void populateDefaultRedirectAttributes(org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                     boolean error,
                                                     java.lang.String message)
        Populates the RedirectAttributes with its default values. Those values are used for displaying an alarm informing a user about the success or failure of his action
        Parameters:
        redirectAttributes -
        error - True if the user's action failed, e. g. when he mistypes his password when he is trying to change his email address, False if the action was completed without failure
        message - The message the user is intended to see. This might be a failure message or a message indicating success
